text: Is Nimble based on Python? The call to the methods using object$method(arg) looks not like standard R synthax.

text: compareMCMCs is an awesome package. You can compare the fitting of your model in Nimble vs. Jags, Stan and other BUGS programs in a few lines of code. See <https://github.com/nimble-dev/compareMCMCs>

attachments.text: Tools for comparing MCMC efficiency from nimble and/or other engines

text: For CMR models expressed as HMMs, is the model likelihood exactly the same for Stan and nimble? I heard that there are subtle differences with Stan, but I may be wrong.

elements.text: For CMR models expressed as HMMs, is the model likelihood exactly the same for Stan and nimble? I heard that there are subtle differences with Stan, but I may be wrong.

text: Same I'd say from I understand it from here <https://mc-stan.org/docs/2_26/stan-users-guide/hmms-section.html>. Stan also has the marginalized likelihood for CMR models which is available in Nimble through nimbleEcology, which <@U0203USKJRE> will cover soon. See also Yackulic et al. awesome paper <https://esajournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/eap.2112>.

attachments.title: 2.6 Hidden Markov models | Stan User’s Guide
attachments.text: Stan user’s guide with examples and programming techniques.
